Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel during out stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: ekellylou
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with another couple and stayed here for three nights in the middle of March. We also visited Florence and Rome after our stay in Venice. Our flight to Venice landed at 8:30 a.m. on Sunday morning. We took the Alilaguna (slow) boat from the dock near the airport to the San Zaccaria stop. I believe it was about 13 euros per person, and I think it was well worth it. The walk to the hotel maybe took 10 minutes from the San Zaccaria stop. We arrived a little early to check in and were allowed to leave our luggage at the hotel until we could check into our rooms. We left for an initial walk around Venice and had lunch at a very nice place that was behind the hotel (can't remember the name, but the food was very good). We were given rooms on the floor where breakfast was served. There was a little corridor off of the breakfast area; our room and the other couple's room was directly off of the corridor and the location of our rooms was very convenient. I've read other reviews where the writers think it would be weird to have a room off of the breakfast area, but we enjoyed it very much. My husband would go get us a cappuccino early while we were getting ready -- loved that. Then we would go for breakfast which was good and plentiful. Also, we never heard any noises from the breakfast area in our rooms. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy, with the waiter bringing fresh, hot croissants to the table. The coffee and cappuccino were very good. The waiter was very friendly and attentive. The front desk staff were exceptional, and provided help and information at our every request. We enjoyed several glasses of wine on the terrace off of the breakfast area and also the downstairs terrace several times. I don't think we had an "updated" room, but it was very nice, regardless. The room was small as was the bathroom, but exceptionally clean. There was a very good "close-up" makeup mirror in our bathroom, but if you are accustomed to styling your hair with a typical American blow dryer, you need to take your own with the appropriate electrical connection converter. The bed was extremely comfortable. We paid 10 euros for Wifi for our entire stay (three nights). The hotel is very convenient to San Marco -- maybe a 5-7 minute walk. There are many small sandwich shops close by that are very good for lunch. Almost every restaurant we visited was very good. We enjoyed going to the Coop supermarket - there is a good and inexpensive selection of wine there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. In my opinion, it had the charm and character we were expecting of a hotel in Venice, and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “short break for easter”
Reviews.Author: josephine s
Reviews.Content: A short break in Venice for Easter and again at Hotel Casa Verardo. Our room was elegant and simple but with all the comforts as we expected.The little courtyard on the Hotel back was such a nice one! plenty of green plants and white flowers . Breakfast good and quite various.Receptionist ready at all our necessity.Very easy to reach the main attractions . The restaurants they booked for us were quite good and close by the Hotel. Really Casa Verardo Hotel is always , for comfort and location, a very good choice in the city of Venice for us.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: arutema47
Reviews.Content: great view from the room and very near from st. marco. though the room was quite small, everyone expects that in vennis. staffs spoke english and were very nice

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappysnapperDevon
Reviews.Content: Everything was great - couldn't fault it. Friendly staff and the location was perfect - quiet, yet close to everything. The bedrooms may not be as large as those you find in modern hotels in the States, but hey! this is a 16th Century Palazzo - quaint and with loads of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but very unlike the website”
Reviews.Author: AndrrewB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pleasant enough but I felt more misled by the website than I ever have by any other hotel website. I always take hotel websites sceptically, but this one really surprised me. Our room looked nothing like any of the rooms shown in the website. We had booked a 'deluxe' room rather than the basic 'classic', but even so the room was small with spartan furnishings - we only had a single hard chair to sit on in the room, in their website the 'deluxe' room is shown with a sofa, a desk chair and a footstool, not to mention an elegant chest of drawers and a wardrobe, all we got was a stolid utilitarian wardrobe that looked like it came from a stalinist design manual. I had the impression from the website that all rooms were individually furnished and decorated with as they put it 'enriched textiles'. Actually all the rooms I saw into on our floor were identical to ours. Also, I spotted that a room shown as a 'deluxe' room on the website was included in the photos on TripAdvisor as a 'junior suite' - had someone made a mistake? The wifi is a pain to use, it is free but parcelled out in such mean packages that it gets irritating to keep having to go back to the reception desk to ask for another session. The rooms on the first floor all appear to open into the breakfast room, which seems a bit strange. I'm glad I didn't have one of those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Robertwi1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Verardo the 2nd weekend of December 2011. The location is great - as others have said, less than 5 minute walk from San Zaccharia vaporetto stop and the hotel's directions in what can be confusing Venice were great. Check-in was very efficient and the 2nd floor rooms were comfortable for our party of 2 couples. The hotel is a renovated palace next to a canal (what isn't in Venice), with the typical Venetian uneven floors and lush tapestries. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet with plenty of variety and the smell of cornettos (croissants) greeting us as we came down the stairs each morning. Staff was direct but polite (buona sera!). Had some issues with the "free" Internet, but the staff resolved them without argument. The hotel is very convenient to numerous restaurants, bars, and shops, and Piazza San Marco, but felt a lot further away (very quiet). To get to San Marco, you have to pass over the canal with a view of the Bridge of Sighs...what a nice way to start your visit to Venezia!!

Reviews.Title: “little charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: josephine s
Reviews.Content: We have been at Casa Verardo for a short week end during the the " Madonna della salute " festivity. it was so pleasant to stay there! The building located in the center but set apart from the traffic is originally ancient furnished , so warm and elegant without be pretentious as many seen Hotel in the city.The room was fine and spacious with a good view over the city. Delicious the breakfast in the morning and the staff very clever and smiling. We'll certainly return at Casa Verardo !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Russell1013
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. Our room was a little small but it was very nice. The bed was comfortable and the shower was nice, those are usually the two most important things to me. The location was what made this hotel amazing. It is less than a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's square and the vaparetto stop. Even though the hotel is so close to St. Mark's square it feels to be in a less touristy area than other parts of Venice. There are several great restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. When I go back to Venice I will definitely look towards staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 101W
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Casa Verardo and found immediately that our two nights there were going to be difficult. We had paid for a larger room and we couldn't even imagine what a small room felt like if this was described as larger. (Our room had a terrace which we were told counted towards the larger space despite the fact that it was way too cold to even go out there during the day). We had to stack our suitcases as there wasn't enough room for both anywhere. On top of that, the room was stiflingly hot so we were up all night and there was some sort of scent that neither of us could bear. We left after one night of staying there as we honestly couldn't take it anymore. We complained to the staff and there was no offer of a refund. Another room was checking out as we were complaining and apparently left without paying so the owner paid more attention to the other party than us. We didn't even put up a fight as we simply wanted to just get out of there. I have never written a poor hotel review before (and I stay in hotels three nights a week for work that aren't always what I would call "nice") but I felt duped by these reviews so I didn't want someone else to feel the same.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: wendy h
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at Casa Verardo. The location was excellent, a short walk from Piazza San Marco, and from the San Zaccharia vaparetto stop, with restaurants and shopping all around us. The breakfast was simple but very good. The service was excellent, the room spotless. In warmer weather the terrace and garden would be lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalimata
Reviews.Content: Located on the quieter side of piazza san marco, technically in the Castello area, Casa Verardo is well placed. specially as we planned to spend most of our time at the Biennale, the hotel was a beautiful 10 minute walk from the Arsenale and Giardini, the 2 main venues. It is also a quick walk from the San Zacharia vaporetto stop with almost no steps to climb and no getting lost. The hotel is compact like most Venice hotels and expensive for what you get. Again like most Venice hotels! Our triple room was very spacious and the bathroom was luxe, with a bathtub and separate wc. Lots of hot water too. The room was off the breakfast room so a bit awkward in the morning as you walked right into someone's breakfast, but it was not really a problem. Breakfast was adequate. They could make a slight variation on the choice of fruit, cheese, cold cuts as it's limited and repetitive. Service was great. Check in was fast and easy. They allowed an hour's exyension on the check out time which is always good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel close to Piazza San Marco!”
Reviews.Author: DollySam
Reviews.Content: Casa Verardo is like an oasis in the Venetian sea of people! Our room was small but elegantly furnished and spotlessly clean each and every day. A simple but ample buffet breakfast is served every morning along with lots of fresh hot coffee and frothed milk -- with a wonderful terrace available in good weather. The hotel is a five minute walk from the vaporetti stop and is within walking distance to many wonderful shops, cafes and restaurants. Piazza San Marco is also just a short walk. (There are steps to cross the bridge at the hotel entrance so be forewarned!) The staff was wonderful and so helpful when my husband became ill during our stay. In short, this is a special place and comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the service.”
Reviews.Author: K_E_AUS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite which was a nicely appointed room. The breakfast was decent & the location was great, thank goodness for these redeeming factors as we had a couple of issues. There was some confusion regarding the room layout, I had booked for 4 guests, advising that 1 of us would be arriving on a different day to the rest of us. We had 4 beds on the first night, then returned to our room the afternoon of day 2 to only 3 beds in the room, when our 4th guest was about to arrive. I was told this happened because I didn't tell staff I needed the 4th bed that night... be sure to clarify specific room requirements with staff each morning to ensure this doesn't happen to you, an inconvenience to you & the staff. The other issue we encountered was in regards to wifi. Wifi is given to guests in 3 hour brackets, which is fine, but when we asked for more when these had expired, we were told that it is not included and we would have to pay for it (as this is how things are done in Venice). In the end we were given 'free' 30 minute passes, which don't last long when shared between 4 people. The staff made us feel like we were continually inconveniencing them, by continually having to ask for another 30 minutes of access. It would have made everyones life easier if they would have given us one 3 hour card instead of six 30 minute cards! I believe that for 330 Euros a night there should be unlimited free wifi access included. A shame about the service as it is a nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, central but quiet situation”
Reviews.Author: Sabine_and_Wouter
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, good breakfast (quite typical for italian cities, not extremely elaborate, but if you are a "normal" breakfast eater, you find everything you need), very friendly staff, professionaly run hotel. Very good situation (about 5 minutes walking from the waterboat stop San Zaccharia - which is comfortable with heavy luggage - central prostition for your walks through the city - quiet)

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: car_1_11
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation for a double room and were confirmed for a double "French bed". When we got there it turns out the French bed was a very small room and quite cramped. The next day we asked the manager about the possibility of a mistake and he explained that small rooms are common in Venice as they don't have a lot of space in the city. He could see our dismay and very kindly offered to upgrade us to a larger double that someone had cancelled (at no extra charge!). Well, that room was gorgeous and spacious so if you are going there and comfort is important be sure to spend the extra $ and get the deluxe room. The hotel has a wonderful garden area and also is centrally located so we walked most everywhere. The management was very accomodating and we were really pleased with our stay there and would definitely go back. Venice is truly beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: debstrappa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Verardo for 2 nights in July with 3 adults, this hotel was lovely a little bit hard to find the first time but then easy to get to everywhere in Venice! Close to St Marks square and not far from the Rialto bridge. The room was lovely, breakfast was fantastic. If you want to go to Murano Island the hotel has a agreement with Marco Polo Glassware in Murano, it's a great trip they pick you up at the hotel and take you on a private taxi to Murano, they do a glass blowing show and then take you to the gallery, there is no pressure to buy but they have lovely glass designs. Then they take you back to Venice very good morning out! We happened to be there for a festival with fireworks fantastic! Hotel staff where very helpful and lovely, would definately be back! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: asleeds
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 nights stay at this hotel. We booked it in February as it was an anniversary trip and therefore paid top price, which now seems very expensive as prices quoted for the rest of the year are far less than we paid. We booked early so we could book the room with a private terrace. The room was very small so we expected the terrace to be an extension of the room. We were very disappointed with the furnishings on the terrace. The seats were so low that we were unable to sit on them as well as being very uncomfortable. After putting up with them for a couple of days we asked for better seating to be provided. Reception said they would have to phone the owners which they did and eventually agreed to supply 2 chairs. We then went out assuming the chairs would have been changed by the time we returned. They had provided more chairs but they were plastic chairs which were very dirty and looked as if they had come from a rubbish dump. We complained again and said that the replacement chairs were unacceptable. Reception again rang the lady owner whilst my husband was there. He was upset at the response he heard i.e. the chairs were SUN BLEACHED and any way no one else had complained. We must thank the manager at this point as he took it upon himself to provide us with 2 comfortable chairs. I feel this hotel is overpriced and overall we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended. clean, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: FredC96
Reviews.Content: little hard to find without a map. great location for main Venice attractions and Vaporetto stops. friendly service. clean room, comfortable mattress, and above average European breakfast. also centrally located for selection of restaurants. (most of which, unfortunately are expensive in Venice for what you get)

Reviews.Title: “A perfect peaceful Venetian Palazzo away from the crowds.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela079
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful little Palazzo for four nights. This was my second visit and my husbands first. What a delight! Away from the crowds yet very central. a stones throw from St Mark's Square. A notice in the spacious bedroom overlooking a tiny bridge over a canal asked us' not to place our cases on the 17th century furniture'! The staff were so helpful. They recommended and booked meals for us and advised us about many things to do and see.We both want to return to Venice and we will be returning to Casa Verardo!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: KatieB82981
Reviews.Content: You can't really beat Casa Verardo's location - it's steps from Piazza San Marco, but tucked away on a quiet side street, and it's within walking distance of many major attractions. I stayed with my parents on a recent trip to Italy, and we were all incredibly pleased. Our room was comfortable and stylish, and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. There are also fresh croissants with breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Spotless with Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChristineRR
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in Italy, of which three nights were spent in Venice at Casa Verardo. What a delightful place to stay! Casa Verardo was beautiful, comfortable, exceptionally clean, and incredibly well-located. The included breakfast was fantastic, particularly the fresh croissant and the coffee served with a small pitcher of frothed milk. We liked the staff very much. They were kind and attentive to our needs. We had a problem the morning after our first night and it was dealt with swiftly and satisfactorily. We enjoyed talking with one particular man at the front desk (whose name I regret I did not ask) about Venice's culture and history. When we return to Venice, we will stay at Casa Verardo.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: fismeats
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located close to Piazza San Marco and the 'waterbus' to the airport and is in a quiet location just off the main streets. The hotel itself is very nice and traditional but the rooms were very small and lacked any 'extras' that would encourage us to return. The mattresses were old and starting to sag in the middle (annoying when a double bed is just two singles pushed together which creates a hard ridge in the centre), the heating was up way too high and didn't respond to the thermostat in the room - to the extent that we had to open the window to sleep (in below zero temperatures). The room safe was accessible with a key (which means any staff could access) and all facilities were 'extra' - including coffee/tea, wi-fi, etc. Whilst the staff were perfectly pleasant, I got the feeling they were just 'going through the motions' of running a hotel and didn't really have their hearts in it. The manager even walked into our room one day without knocking! I haven't stayed in Venice before so I'm not sure if this experience is standard or not however we'd stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet canal, convenient, charming”
Reviews.Author: ms mg
Reviews.Content: Special without pretension, good bed , spacious bathroom, very lovely patio on the ground floor, atmospheric breakfast room, very clean. Good connection to the mainland from the vaporetto stop after you find it the first time ( print out the online map and directions!) , near several restaurants, safe neighborhood away from the crowds yet convenient. Great staff, elevator, room safe large enough for a netbook. Delicious coffee and hot chocolate in the small cozy bar for about the same $ as stopping in anywhere else. Recommended for atmosphere, and we would return for the comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spotless & Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: beech_bunnie
Reviews.Content: Only a 3-minute walk from St. Mark's Square and two blocks from the Grand Canal's boat stops; the hotel is close to the sites, food and shopping! Rooms are very clean and spacious, staff accommodating and the breakfast buffet consisted of fresh baked croissants, ham & salami cold cuts, cheese, cereal, yogurt, a variety of breads & crackers with beverages of orange juice and coffee, cappuccino, espresso: all very filling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: FritzP
Reviews.Content: We booked our 10 day vacation in Italy through European Destinations. They offered a transfer option that included a water taxi and a guide to get you to your hotel lobby. When we arrived on 19 Oct., the high tide was in and our taxi had to drop us off at the Campanile di San Marco stop. I know we paid a lot more than the usual water taxi for this transfer, but had it not been for our guide Sophia, we'd have spent a couple hours dragging our luggage down the narrow streets trying to find this Hotel. With that said, while the Hotel is hard to locate, it is very clean and the breakfast was delicious. On the down side, our room was terribly small and the "King" bed was really two twins shoved together. At least they used King bedspreads and sheets! I would recommend the Casa Verardo because the location to San Marco, cleanliness, friendliness and a good Breakfast all combined to give us an overall positive experience while in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was in a good location for restaurants and attractions. The hotel was clean, and the staff was friendly. It is a little further away from the train station, but a quick water taxi ride or 30 minute walk will get you there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelinda20
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice just as the sun was setting. We took the boat #1 down the grand canal so we could see all the sights. It was breathtaking. The hotel is located about a five minute walk from the San Zaccaria stop. Be sure you copy the excellent directions the hotel gives you. The hotel is at the end of a long, narrow alleyway, so that you can just barely catch a glimpse of the sign, which is vertical! The location is perfect. Walking everywhere is easy. It is so much fun to be on St. Mark's square at night. Daytime it is so jam packed with the day-trippers that I found it unappealing. Once they leave it is lovely. The cafe orchestras are just wonderful. We spent a good hour every night listening to the beautiful music. The hotel itself is excellent. Very comfortable. The very best part for us was the private, cozy, enclosed terrace in the back of the hotel. Both nights we were there, we shared a bottle of wine by candlelight. We were the only ones back there...very romantic. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Caught a boat to the airport at the same San Zaccaria stop. Very very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “An easy 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco.”
Reviews.Author: MissMandaMay
Reviews.Content: After a long day of traveling to Venice from the US, with a half-day stop over in Milan, this hotel was a good find. We found the staff friendly, the hotel quiet and nicely decorated, and the room very clean with a decent size bathroom. Great location! An easy 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. Good breakfast. Rolls with meat and cheese, fresh fruit, a couple of cereal options, yogurt, juice, coffee.... Our only disappointment was that the website and confirmation email stated that WiFi was available, which generally means that it is included, but when we arrived they wanted to charge an additional 3 Euros for 30 minutes, 10 Euros for 3 hours or 20 Euros for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: andy998
Reviews.Content: Lots of positive reviews on Trip Advisor and I'm not about to change that. We stayed for a couple of nights and found it to be a great little hotel in an excellent location - about 30 mins by vaporetto from the railway station, it is ideally situated for sightseeing, being a very short walk from Piazza San Marco. Staff were all very helpful, making our stay an absolute pleasure. Breakfast was fine - whether taken inside or on the small but very pleasant terrace. There's also a downstairs courtyard which is excellent for a coffee or something stronger in the evening. Room was quite small, but not a problem as very comfortable and clean with good air conditioning. A real find - would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Primozk
Reviews.Content: Good (if not best) choice to stay in Venice. Location: Not easy to find, but you can ask waiters at Campo Ss. Filippo E Giacomo, they will know. 5-10 mins walking from Piazza San Marco. Rates a bit on the high side, but acceptable for Venice. Room on third floor was overlooking a quiet canal. Period furniture, looking 5-10 years old, but well kept. With air conditioning, On cleanliness there is room for improvement. Breakfast: was good. Try to get a table at the balcony Staff was very nice and very helpful;

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: agera
Reviews.Content: Everything was just Superb! our only wonder is : how come not 4 or 5 *???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - great location, nice room, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MM7NY
Reviews.Content: This was a two-week vacation during which we visited Venice, Florence, Ravello (on the Amalfi Coast), and Rome. We paid almost exactly the same amount per night for each of the four hotels, and all were selected because they were pretty highly rated on TripAdvisor and appeared to be in convenient, central locations. Casa Verardo got us off to a great start and was one of our best hotel choices. The staff was very nice and very helpful; the hotel was clean and well maintained; breakfast was good; the location was convenient (quite close to Piazza San Marco, but on a quiet side street); and the room and the hotel were attractive from an architectural/design point of view. Good hotels in Italy are not inexpensive, but at Casa Verardo we felt that the facility, the service, and the location made it a better value than some of the places we stayed later in our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent staff, convenient, but hard to find at first”
Reviews.Author: LoisInBoca
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a family member and we found the hotel staff to be very helpful, the price fair, and the hotel to be nicely appointed, clean and in a quiet location. They have a person at the desk 24/7 for security and questions. A nice breakfast is included in a big foyer area. If you go, make careful notes on how to get to the hotel, as the street leading from town is more like an alley, about two persons wide (with a great take out pizza place on the left side going to hotel), ending in a bridge over a canal. It doesn't register to Americans as a street, but you will be glad when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little gem!”
Reviews.Author: nattie_c69
Reviews.Content: Really polite, helpful staff, central but peaceful, very cute, a little secret gem. Overlooking a small canal, greatly restored, amazing little decoration details. Lovely owner's dog! Would go back there any time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: octanou
Reviews.Content: We've been there with my wife at the end of 09, I booked after seeing review on the internet and because we wanted something close to the center. Rave review on Casa Verardo could not be truer, this hotel is fantastic. Probably the best were I ever stayed, it has a very nice and friendly staff, the location is perfect (very close to san marco but still retired enough to avoid the huge crowd) and it has an awesome atmosphere. You can really feel what it was like to live in a palazzo back in the time ... It is a bit pricey,but so are all hotel in venice ... Only thing that could be improved is the breakfast (still it's ok).

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel, strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ted999
Reviews.Content: Hotel Casa Verardo - very elegant rooms, very nicely furnished. Wonderful view of a small canal. Excellent breakfast. Generally quite quiet. Staff incredibly helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel. (Once you get used to the fact that everything in Venice is costly, you can really have a nice time - we paid somewhat less than $200 a night for this hotel in March 2010 - definitely worth every penny. Location - a short walk (1/2 a mile) northeast of San Marco Square. You get off the Vaporetto at Santa Zaccaria and go straight back to Rasse street....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Dominey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Casa Verado over the New Year (2009) we wanted an affordable hotel that was centrally located and were very pleasantly surprised. The location is great, just a short walk from San Marco Piazza and the vaporetto stop San Zaccaria. The hotel is situated at the end of quiet calle, reached via its own little canal bridge. Our room was large & clean with high ceilings and tasteful decor (not too chinzy, even for Venice standards)! The room was situated off the main salon where a typically Italian (pastries, cake & coffee) breakfast was served, We found the staff to be very helpful in making restaurant reservations, all in all we had very pleasant stay and found Casa Verado offered excellent value for money, we would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: BruPete
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful visit to Venice and were Very nicely served at Casa Verardo. The location is perfect for walking to all of the sights. We were the last group for breakfast one morning and the first group for breakfast the following morning. On all occasions the staff went out of their way to make sure we had whatever we needed, including Wine, Gondolas and Doctors! The rooms were a bit small, but very adequate and clean. We would definitely return to Casa Verardo.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars service!”
Reviews.Author: LeoUk75
Reviews.Content: just come back from Venice. A friend of mine suggested to stay at Casa Verardo and i can only say him "thank you very much"!! I travel a lot for business and leisure so i am quite an experienced traveller. The hotels is so charming, elegant and very nicely decorated. It is located just few steps away from San Marco square and from the oher main attractions in Venice. But what was the best at Casa Verardo was the service: all the staff, especially Pier and Claudio provided us a real 5 stars service: nothing was a problem for them!! And this really made my stay in Venice so easy and i felt like at home. Thank you, i will stay with you again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “unexpected discovery in Venice”
Reviews.Author: brigitte_UK_cool
Reviews.Content: My trip in Italy keeps on in Venice... casa Verardo is a lastminute booking for me.. and.. let me say, I have been very very lucky!!!! I find in this hotel: kindness, skill, culture, suggestions... The staff take car fo you as you are a baby... :-) it's a family-run hotel.. I come back and I recommend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A one-off holiday”
Reviews.Author: KIKKID
Reviews.Content: It was my father's 70th and 9 of my family came to stay at Casa Verardo for 4 nights. It came highly recommended and it didn't disappoint - the hotel is completely charming. It is tucked away from but yet so close to the general hub with its own little canal: a real gem. The interior had been done so beautifully as well and I loved the fact that the hotel had both courtyard & terrace. It was just perfect for us; amazing location; great breakfast; lovely staff; very comfortable & clean rooms. Our trip was quite a unique one with it being a celebration and we requested many things of the hotel but nothing was a problem and everyone, particularly Pier was totally brilliant at accommodating us all. They provided a 5STAR service - what a special place and what special special memories, thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience-beautiful hotel-some wonderful staff--but it was also a bit disapointing”
Reviews.Author: MEFHouston
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel. The breakfast was very nice and some of the staff were very nice and extremely helpful. My main disapointment was that I was told I would have to change rooms. This bothered me because I phoned the hotel a week before my arrival to ensure that I would not have a room change after reading a couple of bad reviews by guests complaining about their rooms being changed or lost on Trip Advisor. Sure enough, when I arrived I was told I needed to change rooms. Pier, the manager, who is an extremely nice person, told me that I needn't worry, all my belongings would be carefully moved... I was disapointed to find when I came back to the hotel that night, that my belongings were not moved with care or put in their proper places. My toiletries were in one bag and the contact solution leaked on my make-up, the clothes were not hung-up, etc. The new room was a lovely little room upstairs, but I was surprised that not much care was given in moving my possessions given that the manager knew that I was not happy about being moved. I would have thought that they would have really made an effort to make the move nice for me as Pier indicated he would. I wrote Pier an e-mail when I came home detailing what happened and he did not respond. I thought I was very straight forward and I told him what my concerns were. In hindsight, I wish I had also gone into more detail telling him about my positive perceptions about the hotel. Overall, I think it's a lovely hotel and the people are very nice. I had some great conversations with some of the staff, the building is lovely and overall it is a good value. I recommend the hotel to others, my only caution is that if you do not want a room change, I would get a guarantee, perhaps in writing. I also was not given a lower rate for the new room and I think it would have been appropriate given the circumstances. Overall, I liked the hotel. but think they need to better organize their reservations as well as not move guests who don't want to be moved! :) If they iron out this type of problem, it will raise the quality of the hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superficially clean”
Reviews.Author: MN4ME
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with extended family and enjoyed the location of the hotel very much. I was put off by the smell of incense in the hallway beyond the front desk, thinking it was used to cover up moldy smells. The information sheets in our room were dirty and stained and the sign asking us not to put our luggage on the bed made me give the bedspread a second look - it was FILTHY on the bottom side. The more I looked I found that mold was present. I understand the need for thin towels due to the humidity but our bath towels were frayed, yellowed and stained. The rooms were small - typical for Venice. The breakfast was very basic. Unlike other reviewers I found the front desk to be somewhat dismissive to the travelers. I listened as one person got one set of information and another person got different information for the same question from the same front desk person. Perhaps it is the end of the season and staff was tired of the guests. We payed about 250.00 US dollars a night for our room that looked out over a tile roof. This was their "best rate". Only for the location would i recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location on quiet canal---great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: alioopOviedo_Fl_
Reviews.Content: We were steps away from St. Mark's Square and many places to eat and shop! The hotel is a former palace and although the rooms were small, they were very nice. We would stay again and recommend it to friends. The only thing I would say is the shower in our bathroom had mold along the base---the rest of the room and hotel itself was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “What a great suprise and value”
Reviews.Author: tripadvuser
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this our stay in this hotel and Venice. Venice is a magical city. Of the four hotels that we stay in Veince, this was our by far our favorite. The location is great, a 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. The room was excellent and comfortable for a family of 4. The bathroom was very nice - a real shower The staff was friendly and helpful. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: Venezie
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at Casa Verado in 2006 when we decided we wanted to do something special for our 25th wedding anniversary - we had a fantastic time! The hotel is extremely well situated, only minutes away from the waterfront and St Marks Square, yet quietly secluded away from the hussle and bussle. The staff were friendly, the rooms well furnished and cleaned expertly each day. Breakfast was delicious with the option to eat on the small terrace overlooking a small canal. Bookings can be made via the front of house for trips to Murano and the other small islands surrounding Venice, as well as pre-booking a Gondola. Don't be taken in by the Gondoliers as you sight see - their prices can be on the high side. We liked it so much we returned in June 2008 and are planning our third stay in Sept 09.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a short stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: travellor28
Reviews.Content: A truely lovely hotel, in a great location. We got a water bus down to San Marco square and it is literally a 5 minute walk to the Hotel which is located right on one of the small canals. We were lugging a good few bags with us as we were heading on a week long cruise from Venice and there really was no hassel getting there, it cost us 6euro on the water bus. Very friendly staff, rooms clean and tidy and of a decent size. would highly recommend it as a great base in the heart of the Venice sights. Very quite by day and night so sleep wont be disturbed. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Respite in the Centre of Venice: Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: World2Enjoy
Reviews.Content: We had 3 days to enjoy Venice from this fantastic location. Delightful hotel, and personable staff; comfortable rooms; pleasant common areas (indoors or on the deck)for breakfast, or a quiet courtyard for picnic lunch or tea. 4 minutes to Piazza San Marco, and wonderful restaurants. An easy walk from the Grand Canal vaporetti. After passing through bustling crowds, past beautiful shops, and beckoning resaurants, we arrived at this quiet and pleasant respite in the center of Venice. Our 3 children (17, 15 and 10) were warmly welcomed. Staff was very helpful, offering suggestions, directions, and promptly making arrangements for gondola rides, or airport transfer. And the air-conditioning was great in the face of 38C weather! We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “it has been a dream!”
Reviews.Author: Direzione_Hotel
Reviews.Content: I have been in Venice last november 2008 with my boyfriend for a schort week.end. It has rained every day but it has been a dream as well! It was my first time in Venice and everything seemed magic. Hotel Casa Verardo is located in a stretegic position, just a few walk from San Marco square. We have been accommodated in a beautifull room with red carpet and red drappes with the view on the canal, I really felt like a princess in a castle! All the staff has been superb and excellent, my boy friend was ill on the second day and we had breakfast in the room that was so good with high quality of food. The milk and the croissant were the best I've eaten in my life! The reception staff have been so helpfull with me they suggest all the pharmacies close by the hotel for my boyfriend ill and they give us all usefull information to visit Venice in every corner and beautifull street. I suggest Hotel Casa Verardo for anyone who like good place, good service and who like "live a dream". Thanks Casa Verardo my stay in Venice has been fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location and value”
Reviews.Author: giz888
Reviews.Content: Room - Newly renovated with nice decor and bathroom. Room given came with an attached room with a single bed. Location - great location as it is next to St Mark's Square. Value - For the price it charged, it is value for money! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectation”
Reviews.Author: JAB11Columbus_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Went to Italia for 1st time in October of 08 landing in Venice. We had heard so much about how Venice was no longer genuine and a tourist trap. There were certainly lots of tourists but plenty of opportunity to "experience the real." No problem taking the Vaporetto, getting off at the San Zacarria stop and making it to our hotel. Verardo is close to St. Mark's but not too close. The rooms and staff were stellar. Our room was spacious with a gorgeous canal view. Clauddio was genuinely helpful. We had heard so much about the paltry European breakfasts - not the case here. My wife still raves about the fresh baked bread with orange marmalade. Verardo was stellar.

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: flushing
Reviews.Content: extraordinary hotel we stayed at the casa verardo for 9 wonderful nights. the staff are very proffesional,courteous, and very helpful with information. the hotel is perfectly located, a short but quet distance from st. mark's. the rooms are spacious and modernly layed out. the breakfast are fine, and better than the usual italian hotel breakfasts. each staff member was wonderful. when i, am lucky enough to return to venice, i will only look to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel- excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 31man
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Verardo during carnival season and had a great time! Room was large, beautifuly decorated, warm and clean, quiet with nice canal view!!! Bed was big and very comfortable! Breakfast satisfying! The hotel itself was very atmospheric! The hotel staff, gentle and efficient, especially Claudio at the reception who helped us a lot with a problem concerning our car. Many thanks Claudio! Overall a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Casa Verada”
Reviews.Author: PaulO09
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Casa Verada. The location is exceptional, very close to St Marks Square, beautifullly situated, with lovely interiors and very helpful pleasant staff. We stayed in a large room on the 1st floor looking over the canal and it was very impressive - it would suit any special occasion. There are a number of small local cafes and restaurants near by and its an easy stroll around the city. The staff were extremely helpful in suggesting places to visit and for restaurants. It was a fantastic place to mark the end of 2008 and a perfect escape from the snowy conditions outside.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and suitable for Venice”
Reviews.Author: victoriasintention
Reviews.Content: We found Casa Verardo to be very conveniently located just a few minutes walk from St. Mark's Basilica. It's not difficult to find even if you've never been to Venice before - which we hadn't. The hotel was once a large private residence. You can't really tell that now but does retain some details of its past. Our room was comfortable albeit a little on the shabby side. The friendly concierge told us with pride when we checked in that we had a room with a garden view. That was true if you opened the one window in the room and leaned out looking to the right. Otherwise you had a view of an alley. Plus there was construction noise that began about 7:30am each morning. The bathroom was large and very clean. The elevator is so small that two people and their two pieces of luggage won't fit in it. Overall, I wouldn't call this hotel a bargain but it was fine - especially the location - for us for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quaint hotel, quiet, but near everything.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTourer
Reviews.Content: Casa Verardo is an excellent buy in Venice. The staff is extremely helpful, rooms are spacious, very clean and comfortable and the charm of the old palazzo is lovely. Many original details have been preserved. Wonderfully located near St. Mark's, a 5 minute walk, but in a quiet area on a picturesque canal. A great place to recharge for an active day touring in Venice. The front bedrooms on the canal are the first choice on the second (American) floor. Some of the original friezes and frescos are still on the walls along with the originals doors leading to small vestibules for each room. Bathrooms are modern and roomy. The breakfast room has a charming outside patio area to enjoy breakfast overlooking the canal. The Ponte Storto outside the front door is one of the prettiest small bridges in Venice. A large courtyard behind the palazzo is a great place to unwind and chill. The hotel is considered a 3 star hotel, but after comparing it to 4 and 5 star hotels in Italy, I'd say it was much more like a 4 star hotel. A standard Italian breakfast is served each day, with cereal, fresh fruit, cold cuts, yogurt a variety of croissants and rolls with juice, coffee & tea. The hotel is in general quiet and surprisingly spacious, you never feel cramped. A lot of public space for relaxing is available on the first three floors. The staff knows some of the best restaurants in Venice, where locals go. Even in the rain, we found the staff to be upbeat and cheerful and experience there exceptional. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ctannam
Reviews.Content: Casa Verardo is a great place to stay in Venice. Its tucked away just a few streets from St Marks Sq and very easily accessible by vaporetto at the San Zaccaria stop which you can get to and from the airport. The room was very charming with a mix of antique furniture and modern convenience. Breakfast is a simple continental but very nice and well serviced. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoenix1958
Reviews.Content: My family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed at Casa Verardo for one night in early June '08 for 290 euros. We had heard about the hotel in Rick Steve's book and decided to give it a try. We had a room that was called a triple with one extra bed. The room was very cramped for 4 adults but was clean and ok for one night. I definitely would not pay the same price if I was staying more than one night. I think most hotels in Venice set their rack rates very high and then reduce them if needed. The location is right behind San Marco Square and is very easy to reach by the map on their web site. The front desk people were helpful with setting up gondola rides (90 euros for 45 minutes-try to barter elsewhere for around 70 euros) and recommending restaurants. Breakfast was included and consisted of breads, ham, yogurt, cereal, fruit, juice, and coffee. We ate on the outside terrace which was nice.Venice was like a large maze but a great city to see. I would probably stay at Casa Verardo again but would look for a better rate if I was staying more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kevbabe
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the Tripadvisor reviewers who rated this hotel so highly, you were all absolutely spot on! Well placed for the waterbus from the aeroporto, brilliantly placed for St Marks Square, the casa is a converted palace and excellently converted at that. The staff could not have been more receptive, I cannot rate this hotel highly enough, well done you reveiwers. If you are thinking of travelling to Venice, and you must at least once in your lifetime, then wait until you can get a room here. Unmissable!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: comeonburnley
Reviews.Content: The Casa Verardo is in a peaceful location, but close to the main sights in the Castello district. Our room was spacious, very clean and comfortable and the hotel in general has lots of charachter and charm. Staff were very helpful and pleasant and so earlier negative reviews on this site are a real surprise to read. Venice is a stunning city with a photo round every corner. Be aware that it can be very expensive to eat and drink, particularly in the bars and restaurants in the prime locations. Two beers in one of the seafront restaurants cost 18Euros, but obviously the side-street bars and cafes are much cheaper. We purcahased 2 x 72hr water-bus tourist tickets at 31Euros each on arriving at Marco Polo Airport and these proved very good value for unlimited water-bus trips. However, please note that these tickets do not cover the boat trip from the airport to Venice for which you need additional tickets at 12Euro each. On one of our trips, we found that the island of Lido has a superb beach and so we'll be taking swimwear on our next trip to Venice. We will also check-out availability at the Casa Verardo which I can recommend without hesitation,

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return to Venice and Stay at Casa Verardo!”
Reviews.Author: jmarti9832
Reviews.Content: Our room and the hotel were both beautiful and conveniently located near St Mark's Square. Most importantly, the front desk staff were incredibly helpful and very pleasant. The front desk staff at this hotel turn this above average hotel into an "Excellent" one. I hope management takes care of these people because they are irreplaceable.

Reviews.Title: “I donÂ´t have to say much”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Madrid
Reviews.Content: I donÂ´t have to say much, because as soon as I got to this hotel I was turned around. I was supposed to stay there from 1st to 4th of March, I had paid a deposit and had a reservation voucher from HotelClub. In a small lobby there were already people waiting for a transfer to other hotels - I was not alone. They told me they would show me a single room of the same caliber in the hotel nearby of three stars as well. The payment for three nights was 500 euros (around 750 USD). The room they showed me in the hotel "Da Bruno" was 2 to 3 meters, without windows and dirty. There was nothing there but the bed. I told them that this room looked like a prison cell, and I didnÂ´t feel I did something bad, besides I wouldnÂ´t stay there even if I would be paid, jaja. So I left to look for another hotel at 9pm in a strange town full of scam. See review of "Royal San Marco".

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel in a charming palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ParisAurelie67
Reviews.Content: The Casa Vearardo was suggested to me by a friend of mine who stayed in this perfect hotel already three times in the past. The hotel is a wonderfully restored (what a taste!!!) venetian palazzo with high ceilings and large living roooms on the two "piano nobile". It is really one minute walking from San Marco sq. Rooms are large and fully equipped, nice view and very quite. We had the charming room 306 with the wooden beams. Breakfast is above average and it was served in the sunny terrace overlooking the canal. All the staff is very efficient and they were always ready to do their best to help us smiling. Thank you Casa Verardo for making my stai in Venice really unforgettable, i will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumkah
Reviews.Content: This was a very charming hotel, with very friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were nice and a good value. Breakfast was above average. Fairly easy walk from the vaporetto, even with luggage. Several cozy spots in the hotel to sit and have a drink and catch up with friends, without being in our guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Casa Verardo!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmel7106
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Verardo for 5 nights for our honeymoon. The rooms were small, but typical of other hotels. All of the people at the front desk were very helpful. The night manager gave us a wake up call at 3:00am so we would not miss the Alilaguna boat to the airport. We stayed in the room with the private Terrace. We had great weather and used it a lot. The hotel location is great. It is a 3 minute walk to the San Zaccharia vaporreto stop and a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. Easy walking to other famous attractions as well. They offer a free taxi ride to Murano Island (you have to find you own way back). This was the only hotel we stayed at that had an elevator. That was a nice bonus. When we come back to Venice we would definitely stay here again. The staff and the comfort of the hotel made the last stop on our honeymoon very memorable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lorryb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely holiday in Venice. I read all the reports on this hotel and was not disappointed. The hotel is in a fantastic location ( a few minutes walk from St Marks Square but that was far enough to be quiet and peaceful ) , it's website gives great directions so it is easy to find on arrival. The room we stayed in was a standard room so it was not massive but it was just what we needed, comfortable and clean, nice bathroom with a lovely hot shower. They offer larger rooms and suites if desired. Breakfast was lovely , exactly as described by the previous traveller ) Sitting on the terrace on a warm morning was an added bonus as is the courtyard downstairs. Staff very pleasant and helpful although the night receptionist was not as helpful as the others, best to ask for help during the day we discovered. We found a lovely restaurant nearby which was cheaper than others we saw and was really nice , out of the hotel front door and go left down the alley and left again at the end past the launderette - Trattoria Agli Artisti da Piero. We loved Venice and will definitely return to Venice and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was all good!”
Reviews.Author: TLGPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Casa Verardo was the perfect hotel for our recent visit to Venice. We arrived at San Zaccaria vaporreto stop and easily found this gem on a little canal that was about a 7 minute walk from St. Mark's Square. The front desk spoke just enough english to be helpful, kind and patient. They booked tours for us, helped us find money machines, and allowed us to store our luggage on check-out day long after check-out time. The rooms were clean. The showers had wonderful water pressure and the heated towel rack made towels warm and cozy. They do have internet access but you have to pay for it. The only recommendation I would make is to make the internet a free amenity. Casa Verardo was a nice home away from home while traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casa Verardo is a great choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kentuckygirl_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Casa Verardo is a great hotel! The staff was very friendly and courteous. This hotel is very easy to find and in a super location. We had a nice size triple room and a spacious bathroom (a big plus!). The beds were comfortable. I received an on time wake up call every morning. The hotel also has internet service for a very small fee. A light breakfast was included with our room. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at Hotel Casa Verardo.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, perfect location and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kabbe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Verardo in March, right before Easter holiday. Just loved it. Charming, perfect location and realy great value for money compared to what you get in Venice. Read reviews before booking and when we received the room right behind the reception - I was a bit worried (ref. bad review of this room here). But it was great. Spacious (compared to trad. italian rooms), quiet (which was our main consern) and nice in all ways. Service was great - and breakfast was lovely (also compared to Italian standard). A lovely back yard which would have been great if the temperature was a bit warmer. I will definatley be back - and recomend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th visit - and it won't be our last!”
Reviews.Author: maudsters
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve just returned from our fourth stay at this lovely hotel. Needless to say, we like it! The hotel is a very short walk from San Zaccaria vaporetto stop â€“ with only one small bridge to cross in front of the hotel with your luggage. And itâ€™s just a few minutesâ€™ walk - and 2 bridges (one of which has good view of The Bridge of Sighs) â€“ away from Piazza San Marco. The location is so peaceful yet there are at least a dozen bars & restaurants within 100 metres of the hotel. Every part of the hotel is kept beautifully clean and tidy. We occupied room 206 at the back of the hotel. Rooms at the front have a view of the small canal that runs along the front of the hotel. The dÃ©cor is traditional Venetian throughout, with modern bathrooms fitted. Our room had a full size bath with shower above (and a leaky shower screen â€“ slightly annoying having to put a towel down to soak up the water - our only niggle), the usual WC, bidet & washbasin as well as a lovely toasty warm radiator-cum-towel warmer â€“ which seemed to be the only source of heat but more than adequately kept the room and bathroom cosy. There is a tube-type hairdryer and a few toiletries provided â€“ soaps, bottles of shampoo and a shower cap. We find the beds extremely comfortable. They have the latex type mattresses - as opposed to sprung â€“ which in our experience are very popular in Italian hotels (and in our house too!) The four pillows in our room varied in softness/firmness, which suited us perfectly (so I'm sure they can cater for most guests' requirements - people often complain of too-hard pillows - hence my pillow review!)There is a small TV set on the desk and one chair in the room. In the built-in wardrobe, there is a safe, approx. 5 decent sized shelves and a roomy hanging area. I counted the hangers and there were 10 assorted style hangers. There is also a small mini bar containing 2 bottles of beer, 1 small bottle of wine, 2 cans of Coca Cola and 2 bottles of water. I only noticed the price of the Coke â€“ it was â‚¬5.00. We know from past visits during warmer weather that the air-conditioning works perfectly well â€“ thought it worth a mention. We have also enjoyed breakfast on the terrace and relaxing in the pretty courtyard in warmer weather. Buffet breakfast is provided in the lovely breakfast room on the first floor (several of the rooms open out into this space) and in detail, consists of small white crusty bread rolls, butter, sliced salami, ham and cheese, fruit salad (canned), fresh grapefruits & oranges, choice of 3 cereals, milk, orange juice, assorted yogurts, little tubs of jams, marmalade, honey, nutella spread and packs of biscuits and crackers. Angelica and Fernando will bring fresh warm croissants to your table (some days plain, some days with apricot jam inside) and they'll get you tea, coffee, cappucino etc. (lovely coffee â€“ thanks, guys!) Breakfast is served from 8.00 (I think) to 10.30 (Iâ€™m sure!), which should suit most people. Internet access is available â€“ much faster connection this year! â€“ at a cost of â‚¬5.00 for 1 hour or â‚¬10.00 for 3 hours. The PC is located on the second floor salon (just outside our door which was very handy for hubby to check his email) All the staff are efficient, friendly and helpful - from the front desk to chambermaids. Wherever we travel, we have a special request for an extra mattress on the bed to help with my husbandâ€™s back problem â€“ he needs a high bed â€“ and the bed was already made up to meet our needs when we arrived. We never cease to be impressed with this charming little hotel â€“ nothing is too much trouble for them. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and weâ€™ll surely return next time we visit the magical city of Venice. If anyone has any questions, we'd be more than happy to help if we can.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: HolidayinSpain
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel centrally located near Sant Marco Piazza and the Rialto Bridge in Venice. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Small yet reasonably-sized rooms for Italy. My single room was clean and pleasant smelling. I stayed one night for 90 Euros. I was told by local Italian friends that this price was moderate for Venice. The 90 Euros included a lovely breakfast. There was WiFi access for a steep price... around 5 Euros for 30 minutes online. OUCH! However, this was the only drawback. No one should really spend their time online anyway when visiting Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: mayway
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights of our Italian honeymoon at the Locanda Orseolo. The staff spoke great English and were very helpful in arranging Gondola rides. They also offered to set up restaurant reservations and tickets to the opera. We stayed in the Honeymoon suite. It was large with beautiful wooden beams and a view over a canal. Breakfast was great and was included in the price. It was served on a lovely terrace or inside a large breakfast room. The hotel also had a courtyard where we enjoyed a nice glass of wine while waiting for our gonodola ride. The only downside is that there is not a place for taxis adjacent to the hotel. We had to haul our luggage through the streets to the nearest pickup point. It wasn't that bad or that far, but was a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, grat view but...”
Reviews.Author: Coeury
Reviews.Content: Decided to go back to venice after 2 years for an extended we! used TripAdvisor as usual .... hotels were almost all fully booked... but still found this nice charming hotel located in one my favourite part of Venice 'El Castello". Booked a junior suite with Rio view directy from the Hotel via email (170â‚¬/room/night xwith bkfst) The hole WE was GREAT! but just to speak about the hotel itself I'd say: Good points: -Our room was much bigger than the regular venice room size. -The view was great (romm 201) lovely view on both side of a rio - Perfect hotel location -Lovely terrasse and patio (only when it's warm;) Just above Average: Staff is just friendly (always on the computer watching reservations ...you always seem to disturb;) Not very helpfull on any points - Bathroom was not perfectly clean on first night. They apologized but nothing more... - Breakfast just Ok and close to early for a romantic destination (10.30) At the end I was Very surprised to see they were on Michelin Guide selected hotels... I would probably go back.. or not...;)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: LancYorks
Reviews.Content: We booked this wonderful hotel at the last minute and the rates online were excellent value for money. Michele, one of the receptionists, was more than helpful and when we arrived we were presented with a deluxe, canal view room which was opulently decorated. Although we had to change rooms for our third and final night, we had been made aware of this owing to the nature of our late booking. The room we received on the last night was even better than the first and although it did not boast a canal view, the contrasting view over the rooftops of Venice was just as riveting. The continental breakfast was filling and the staff very obliging, in fact all of the staff were very accommodating and friendly. A good value, warm and welcoming hotel, close to San Marco square but still quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Hotel Casa Verado”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 16-18 October. The location was fantastic (just a two minute walk from St Mark's Square, but in a quiet back street next to a tiny canal). We only booked a standard room, and whilst it wasn't huge, it was immaculately clean, nicely decorated and had a lovely big bathroom. Breakfast was fine (standard ham, cheese, rolls, croissants, ceral, fruit, etc). The staff couldn't be more helpful. They recommended some great restaurants to us (away from the expensive rip-off places in the main streets). I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a somewhere to stay that is reasonably priced with good service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Thoroughly satisfying”
Reviews.Author: MarcelDuchamp
Reviews.Content: Casa Verardo is a beautifully appointed, completely modern small hotel (in a restored 16th century building) that is utterly comfortable and relaxed. It's location is remarkable - a few minutes from St. Marks, and yet it is completely removed from the crowds and noise. The staff is always cheerful and helpful. Breakfast is delicious and can be eaten on a terrace overlooking a small canal. The rooms are individually decorated in a Venetian style, comfortable and made up expertly daily. Casa Verardo is an ideal hotel - close to the center of things and yet quiet and reserved. We have stayed there twice in the past 3 years and have always had a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic -”
Reviews.Author: 123abWash_DC
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just got back from a trip to Venice. We stayed at Casa Verardo and we loved it. The staff really made our trip - they were so nice and helpful. Ask them for recommendations for places to eat - they didn't let us down. Next time we are in Venice we will certainly stay there!

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: JPBManchester
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for recomendations for a hotel in Venice and came across a host of write ups on this site about Casa Verardo. I gave it a shot and was not disappointed. The hotel is reasonably priced despite being so close to St Mark's Square and the accomodation itself was ideal. The staff at the hotel couldn't do enough for us and would not let us check out on our final day without breakfast, despite the fact we left the hotel nearly an hour before breakfast started! If you are looking for a hotel in Venice then look no further than this one, I'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Charme, location and luxury service!”
Reviews.Author: susiwest
Reviews.Content: i stayed at Casa Verardo with my parents just a couple of days before going to Florence and Rome. I decided to book at Casa Verardo because i red the reviews on Tripadvisor and i can say i agree with them! The perfect choice in Venice: the hotel is very charming with high ceilings, venetian fourniture, a lovely garden as well as a relaxing terrace where i used to paint during the afternoon; the location is very convinient: just few steps away from Piazza San Marco and all the main attractions and the vaporetto is so close to it! But what was the best at Casa Verardo was the service: the staff is very helpfull, always trying to make its best to satisfy all your requests and this made our staying a really perfect one! I look forward to my next visit to Venice and of course i will stay again at Casa Verardo!!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Verardo is the Hotel to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: newyorktom
Reviews.Content: I reserved at Casa Verardo for my second visit to Venice as i was looking for a small luxury hotel. What a terrific find!!! Casa Verardo is a very centrally located (very close to the vaporetto stop and to San Marco) gorgeous boutique hotel: all the hotel is really nice decorated as well as the rooms are and the AC works perfectly! The breakfast is very good and with a lot of choice (ham, salami, cheese, croissants - my best! -, fresh fruits ...) and you can have it indoor or outside in the cosy terrace overlooking the canal. The staff is very helpfull and always smiling: what a pleasure was to talk with them in the morning! To sit in the linen sofas outside in the charming private campiello (small typican venetian garden) of the hotel, drinking a glass of white wine, is the best after a busy day around this wonderfull city! Of course i will stay again at Casa Verardo for my next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillyBoy013
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very nice 3 night stay at Hotel Casa Verardo in Venice. It is a restored 16th century palace, and is typically European in style in that the rooms are modest, but very nicely appointed and air conditioned. It is conveniently located within a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, but far enough away that it is very quiet inside and around the hotel - it sits on one of the canals and has an outside terrace for relaxing after those long days of walking around in Venice. They serve a nice continental breakfast with absolutely delicious homemade croissants and nice Italian coffee or cappucino. The English speaking staff, especially Babett if you are lucky enough to meet her, were most helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. and basically just appreciative that you are a guest in their hotel. We paid around 195 euro's per night, but I believe July to be their off season. It is also within about 50 yards of a nice square that has plenty of nice shops and choices for eating. Overall, a very nice Italian hotel in a very quiet, convenient location at a very fair price, with great service and an attentive staff. I would highly recommend it and would stay there again if opportunity presents itself. Also, if you are flying out of Venice, they use one of the local water taxi services that is close to the hotel and get to the airport in about 20 minutes, versus the crammed and hot vaporetto's which take over an hour to get there. An expensive but convenient option.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: KellyPaige
Reviews.Content: Arriving at Casa Verardo was simple. The hotel gives wonderful directions. This hotel is beautifully restored and decorated. At the end of the tiny street leading to the hotel is a little square that epitomizes Venice. A delicious family-owned restaurant, 2 mask shops, 2 jewelery shops, a leather shop, a pharmacy, and a small market type shops with fresh fruit. For me it was the perfect location. It was incredibly convenient to San Marco and 2 close water bus stops. The first two nights we had a triple room with absolutely NO VIEW. Looking out our window was a prison-like area with concrete floor and dead plants. We were not very pleased. We asked the man at the front desk if we could possibly change. He said that he would check, but he could not promise us anything. We returned at the end of the day and he said they didn't have anything available until our third night where he could upgrade us to a room with a better view or he could upgrade us to a canal view room for a 50 euro supplement. We went with the canal view room, which was stunning and well worth the 50 euros. The breakfast is delicious with hot croissants with a fruity filling, cereal, fruit....etc. YUM! Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was perfect for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Restored 16th Century Palace - Very Venetian”
Reviews.Author: AnnieGrant
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended the Casa Verardo Hotel to fit with our budget and also for the location. Fortunately she gave my husband detailed directions because I would still be trying to find the hotel! If you're arriving by vaporetto, I'd suggest not taking too many suitcases as there are about three bridges to negotiate before you get to the hotel. When you arrive though, prepare to be charmed. The hotel is a restored sixteenth century palace in an excellent location, about 5 minutes walk to St Marks Square and a little longer to the Grand Canal and the Bridge of Sighs. On arrival, we found our room had been booked as a twin, even though we were on honeymoon. No problems - our room was upgraded for 2 of our 4 nights and it was excellent with a small balcony overlooking a canal. Our second room was much smaller with not much room for our luggage but was still very comfortable and quiet. We found the staff, especially Michael, very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was beautifully furnished with antiques and a small terrace is available if the weather is nice. The fare was typically Italian with cheese, salami, ham, bread rolls and croissants and good coffee. The courtyard would be a lovely place to enjoy a glass of wine if you can find a spare minute from shopping or enjoying beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JWWToronto
Reviews.Content: We were told of the Verardo by friends who had stayed there earlier, and who were very impressed. We were also impressed! We did know before booking that the room would be small, and that we would have to lug our suitcases a long way, but the staff and the ambience made it all worthwhile. The staff (particularly Michel) were exceedingly helpful in answering all sorts of questions, and in making helpful suggestions. The enclosed patio at the rear of the hotel was a marvelous retreat for a quiet drink. We wanted to stay longer, and, if we are fortunate enough to get back to Venice, this is the hotel at which we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Thierry
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in December 2006. Was originally booked into the Casa Kirsch but as they had rooms available in this hotel they asked me if I wanted to move. As I had to come to the Casa Verardo for breakfast it made sense to move. The room itself was very small but I was expecting this in Venice. However it was clean, pleasantly furnished and had everything you'd expect. What really makes this a good hotel is it's location - it's just round the corner from St Mark's. That's great for when you're wandering around the city not quite sure where you are as it's always easy to get back to San Marco and find the hotel. The staff were also very friendly and helpful, making the stay a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KatoMac
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to get the last room available after several acquaintances recommended this hotel. We were so disappointed! Our room, on the first floor, was a coverted office. It was the handicap accesible room; therefore, the bathroom did not have a tub, the shower flowed directly onto the entire bathroom floor and drained, supposedly, through a center drain in the floor. We had inches of water on the floor through the day as we brushed our teeth or dried hair. Because of this drainage problem, the room smelled awful! We could not wait to leave because of the rank smell. The staff was nice but did make any extra effort to make our stay memorable. We felt like second rate guests in the "closet room" behind the front desk...what a shame. We paid far too much for this type of experience and will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: csc329
Reviews.Content: I did a two week tour of Italy and by far Casa Verardo was the best place I stayed in compared to all the hotels in other major cities I visited during my trip. The location is GREAT...close to San Marco but away from the loud hustle & bustle of the tourist scene. Everything you need is in close proximity (i.e. restaurants, internet point, pharmacy, laundromat, convenience stores & all the major tourist attractions). The staff was very friendly & the rooms were lovely! I was a female traveling alone so all these aspects were a plus, plus!! I can't wait to go back & stay there again...thanks to the staff for such hospitable & warm service.

Reviews.Title: “Style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Kiandorf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Verardo for the third time in February this year. Although for us the rates were rather high (we wanted to be there for the end of Carnival - and therefore one of the peak times), our previous visits to the hotel were so enjoyable that we couldn't contemplate staying anywhere else. We were not disappointed. The hotel is family-run and therefore has the personal touch and guests are made very welcome by all the staff who are unfailingly helpful and friendly. The building itself is a former smallish palazzo and the owners have carefully restored and adapted the rooms and public areas with great sensitivity and style, retaining original features and using period furniture to recreate an appropriate atmosphere and ambience. Great attention is paid to detail and the rooms are very comfortable with excellent facilities. Breakfast is continental but ample with plenty of choice. There are several practical advantages in staying at Casa Verardo. Firstly, if you arrive at Marco Polo airport, you can get the waterbus to the waterfront at St. Mark's Square (this provides an interesting trip across the lagoon and a spectacular approach to the city - a unique experience) and it is only a short walk from there to the hotel which is in a quiet location beside a small canal and bridge (very pretty). From the hotel it is only three minutes stroll to St Mark's Square and is in easy walking distance to most places of interest. Nearby there are plenty of good eating places too. The hotel offers a free trip to Murano which is well worth a visit. I would highly recommend Casa Verardo for its efficient service and care, for its convenient location and most especially for the experience of staying in a palazzo which offers such style and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casa Verardo was everything we'd dreamed of and more.”
Reviews.Author: painters
Reviews.Content: The hotel Casa Verardo sits beside a lovely quiet little canal very near the Piazza San Marco. We loved the quiet relaxed atmosphere and the extremely pleasant and helpful staff. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Another plus was the handy laundromat right around the corner. Breakfast was a treat with freshly made croissants and the best coffee we've ever had. We look forward to returning to the Hotel Casa Verardo in the future, it certainly helped to make our vacation in Venice truly unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reputation is well deserved”
Reviews.Author: p-bbradway
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the perfect hotel for our first trip to Venice - the Casa Verardo. We read the Trip Advisor's reviews before booking our stay for 3 nights in late January 2007 directly with Casa Verardo via email.
