Michaele and Deborah were our primary hosts during our 4 day - 3 night stay. They were terriffic and resonsive to our needs and many questions. For example, we went to an Opera house in a palazzo that Michaele recommended - a very unique and worthwhile experience. We selected Room 101 based on a previous guest's review and were glad we did - it is featured on the hotel's website. Other rooms are also quite nice, but we relished the space, privacy, and canal view of our room. The bathroom was newly renovated and was wonderful and spacious. And, the room was ready for us when we arrived (around 12:30 pm, albeit in the low season). The breakfast was ample and on time, although we did not like the croissants. The hotel's directions from the Grand Canal are very precise and accurate. The hotel is incredibly convenient to the GC, St. Mark's and just about anywhere you want to go. It is not located on a main thoroughfare, which quite frankly is a plus in our book. We loved every minute of Venice and the Casa Verardo and wanted one more day (at least).

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Venetian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYCviews
Reviews.Content: Look no further, you will NOT find a nicer, more convenient and accomodating hotel for the money in Venice. Perfect location, very close (but not TOO close) to everywhere you want to be in Venice. Beautifully decorated rooms and a wonderful staff. We just returned from our stay during Carnevale and will most definitely stay here again. Hotel Casa Verardo is an exceptional value and would remain so at an even higher price.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: alannalee
Reviews.Content: I have not long returned from travelling through beautiful Italy. One of my most enjoyable stays was at the Casa Verardo Hotel in Venice during Carnevale. The staff are friendly, the rooms beautifully decorated in a venetian style and the location is perfect. Many shops, places to eat and very close to Piazza San Marco. The Manager Pier, can not do enough for his guests to ensure they have a comfortable and rewarding visit to Venezia. I look forward to visiting Venice again very soon and hope to be a guest again at the Casa Verardo.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCAPPA
Reviews.Content: a lovely hotel ... maybe the 3rd floor is the best !! all employees are so pretty ! we changed room (from the 3rd to the 1st floor : lovely room but in front of breakfast !!! so not so good ) everything was alright ! breakfast so tastefully !!!! many thanks to everybody ! and hope we will come back soon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveVeevers
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed in the Hotel Casa Verardo for a short stay break in January. The Hotel was clean, well decorated, excellently located and staffed by very friendly and helpful professionals. I would highly recomend for anyone staying in Venice and especially for people wanting somewhere very near to the central plaza and the family entertainments by the vaporetta stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,friendly and great VFM”
Reviews.Author: bmarshall
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights on 7 to 10 february 2007 and had a fabulous time. There are so many hotels in Venice that location is important and this hotel is very close to St Marks Square you can easily walk to the square eg the Basilica / Tower/ Doges palace/Museum and return for a rest before the next expedition. We stayed in room 203 one of the smallest and next to the lift but it was quiet, recently redecorated and very very clean. (We even had a large glass chandelier ) Won't tell you how much we paid but it was a real bargain. The hotel staff were all very helpful and the hotels they recommended "Vini da Gigio" and Al Barbarcani were both excellent. The latter is our recommendation it is a family owned and run restaurant 5 mins away with a set 19 euro menu (3 courses) with a free welcome and farewell drink (or you can go for a la carte). We booked on hotelclub/observer as they promised Â£10 off on first booking but havent had that yet . The only draw back for the hotel as mentioned elsewhere on the site is that the breakfast is the same every day

Reviews.Title: “Quite the hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: belle133
Reviews.Content: Such a delightful experience - staff were accomodating and friendly, room was clean, cozy & with a lovely Venetian atmosphere, unbeatable price and the hubb is close by without infringing on sleep! Would recommend it to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Hartacanute
Reviews.Content: We paid for one of the larger rooms shown on their website, and we weren't disappointed - the room was huge! We had a canal view (albeit not the most beautiful canal Venice has to offer), and were very pleased with our choice. Management were very friendly, and pleased to assist. There was a good continental breakfast, and the hotel is only a couple of minutes away from St. Mark's. We would happily stay at Casa Verardo again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: broadband1986
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in December 2006. Excellent location, close to main atttractions (means you can get there before or after the crowds) and close to the main vaporetto stops (means you can get away from the crowds easily). Quite location, great room, friendly and efficient service, breakfast fine, feels like a family hotel rather than a business. Would book again without looking elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel (Arthur Plon)”
Reviews.Author: UTA4U
Reviews.Content: We, my wife and I, recently returned from a trip to Italy and our first stop was four nights in Venice. I`d read about Hotel Casa Verardo on TripAdvisor.com and chose it because it was in a good price range for us. We were extremely pleased with what we found. Great location, charming hotel within 5 minute walk to San Marco Plaza and San Zaccharias vaporetto stop. Location is a huge plus in Venice! The staff was very attentive. The room (No.106) was of a very nice size with a twin bed and big bathroom. Without a doubt if we ever returned to Venice, we wouldn`t even look for any other place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sadsnapper
Reviews.Content: Great location , just a few minutes from piazza St Marco. The room was very quiet and tastefully decorated and warm . The only criticism would be the size of it apart from that it had everything we needed . The continental breakfast was good and the staff attentive and polite . All in all I would happily return for another stay .

Reviews.Title: “awesome and friendly”
Reviews.Author: HiltonHeadTwins
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Recommendations for dinner and gondola were perfect. Staff was very friendly. Arranged all activities. Hotel was very clean. Rooms were very large. Bathroom was extra large. Breakfast was delicious. Beware, the poached egg is extra.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAM4
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Casa Verardo. The staff was very attentive and our rooms were great. The hotel is located with in walking distance of many of the main sights of Venice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. Very close to everything and still quiet for sleeping. Our room was very clean and nice (was the one shown on the hotel's web site) and overlooked the canal. By European standard, very large, and we were able to actually hang out the shuttered window. We stayed here two nights. The staff was most helpful and actually arranged for a gondola ride for us. Excellent coffee, fresh-baked croissants and rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend an I stayed two nights in room 202, which has a view over a small canal. The room was huge with a double queensize bed (very fine linens!), two chairs, an extra bed and a drawer. The room and the bathroom were very clean, and aircondition was working perfectly without making too much noise. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is located within a short walk to St. Mark's square, shops where you can buy something to drink and eat and dining facilities, but also very quiet. We can only recommend the Casa Verardo and would surely choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “a real charming palazzo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Casa Verardo just for a couple of nights in April 2006 along my tour in Italy and i only can say this hotel is the best one i stayed in. A real charming palazzo located at two minutes walknig far from Piazza S.Marco. Nice and really polite staff, delicious breakfast (i loved the croissant) served in the sunny terrace overlooking the canal, very quite position. Of course i'll suggest Casa Verardo to everyone travelling to Venice and looking for a small but really charming and elegant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PHV009
Reviews.Content: We went there from 15 till 19 March 2006. Here are our comments: > Location: perfectly situated (+/- 200 m from St Mark Square). Very convenient also for the Vaporetto stop (San Zaccaria â€“ almost all lines stop and go from there). Really calm neighborhood at night. > Service: friendly welcome, helpful and polite people. > Room: not a suite but still enough space and comfort. Equipment: renovated bathroom, TV, safe & mini-bar. > Breakfast: donâ€™t expect a large buffet but more a typical Venetian breakfast: small breads, croissants, ham, cheese, fruits, biscuits, yoghurts. And, of course, great coffee (but we are in Italy, after all!). Definitely worth the price we paid: â‚¬ 320 for 4 nights. By the way, a visit to Murano (outward journey only + guide in a glass manufacture) is included in this price. Weâ€™ll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, lovely staff, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in winter, Jan 2006. Being students we could only afford the standard room, but it was lovely compared to some of the other hotels we had stayed in across Europe. The room was small, the bed taking up most of the space. But it was recently renovated and had a nice bathroom - the shower was not that small. Don't expect a lovely view if you are only paying for a standard room - we got a view into the building next door - but a room is to sleep in. The breakfast room was my favourite part. It was a lovely open room and in summer they actually have an open courtyard. It always smelt of vanilla and pastires. The staff were always helpful and polite. They always had a restaurant to recommend or would be happy to help us figure out which vaparetto to get. The hotel itself it situated over a lovely bridge and is easy to get to when you first arrive in Venice. Don't be daunted by the alleys at night - we found them safe enough. I would stay here again and would recommend it to those who do not want to blow their budget on a room, but want value for money. Also, I recommend a pizza restaurant called AE OCHE in Venice. It is not in St Marks (so you won't pay a fortune). You have to catch a vaparetto, but they have at least 50 different types of pizza - and they are good!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Casa Verardo - Residenza D'Epoca
HotelInfo.Address: Sestiere Castello 4765, 30122 Venice, Italy
